content.description: Climb up the mossy face on the leading end of the ridge. Giant holds appear everywhere as you ascend, but PLEASE CHECK THEM CAREFULLY. Large loose features abound, and if one of them pulled out while you were standing on it, it would ruin your day.
content.protection: Pads are a nice idea, but they become less and less useful the higher you go. Best just not to fall.
content.location: Right off the trail, the first face you see from where the hiking path splits.

content.description:
Chossy sandstone ridge. Most of the rock is loose, mossy, overgrown, and dirty. Sounds like fun, doesn't it? 

  That said, it has some huge ledges and fun looking faces that may have some potential.
